item.title: Cost vs. Performance: How Sustainable Coatings Maximize an Asset’s Life Cycle
item.description: While cost is an important factor, sustainable coatings and linings deliver significant advantages that maximize an asset’s life cycle over the long run. Find out how.

item.title: Water/Wastewater Asset Protection Guide
item.description: This interactive guide takes the user step by step through the wastewater collection and treatment process and the drinking water treatment, transmission, and storage phases. Details are given on each asset, along with suggestions for coating and lining options for each substrate within the structure.

item.title: Product Description Guide
item.description: A comprehensive list of Carboline products. With direct PDS and product page links, it's a great resource for all pertinent Carboline product information.

item.title: QuickTurn Three-Coat Systems for Field vs. Shop Applications
item.description: Carboline’s Technical Service team is often contacted by contractors, owners and specifiers looking for corrosion-resistant coating systems with high-performance characteristics for small carbon steel structures in exterior environments. These projects can...

item.title: Why Environmental Conditions Matter During Coating Application
item.description: Environmental conditions are vital to the life of a coating system—not just during application, but before and after the coating is applied as well. Conditions that fall outside of the recommended guidelines can have both an immediate and delayed adverse effect on the coating system.

item.title: How to Select Industrial Coatings for Steel Water Tank Exteriors
item.description: Depending on the specific circumstances at hand, there’s a surprising levelof variability in how the application process is performedand whichtypes of industrial coating systemsare best suited for the job. For instance, a fluorourethane or polysiloxane coating may be chosen fora water tank...

item.title: How to Select the Best Lining for Concrete in Wastewater Applications
item.description: When it comes to linings for wastewater applications, concrete substrate has always been trickier than its steel cousin. This is largely because there are so many factors to consider—from concrete repair, laitance removal and new concrete cure times, to outgassing...

item.title: Carboline Flooring Time Lapse
item.description: This time-lapse video displays the installation of a Carbocrete SL resinous flooring system. Carbocrete SL, designed to self-level, is easier to apply than most conventional urethane cement coatings.

item.title: CTSP Episode 153 - Galvanizing vs. Zinc-Rich Coatings
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss the different aspects of protecting steel with zinc. They discuss how galvanizing and zinc-rich coatings are similar, how they differ, and when appropriate to use

item.title: Industrial Coating Systems for Secondary Containment
item.description: When spills happen in an industrial facility, it often involves dangerous chemicals that are harmful to humans and the environment. When these types of spills occur, the containment and cleanup response is critical to minimizing impact on the environment, business operations and a company’s reputation in the community.

item.title: Using Thermal Insulative Coatings for Condensation Control
item.description: When it comes to industrial environments, a variety of condensation issues can occur on process vessels, piping, gas lines, storage tanks or even the sides of metal buildings. In fact, it’s not uncommon to see“sweating” occur on the north sides of storage tanks or the bottom half of railcars during the morning hours, before the sun has warmed the steel substrate.

item.title: 7 Most Common Tools for Industrial Coating Inspection
item.description: In order to ensure compliance with ASTM, ISO and other specifications, there are specific coating inspection tools that are necessary to have on hand at every stage of the coating process. Ideal for on-site quality control assessments…

item.title: How to Manipulate Coating Viscosity for Better Application
item.description: What is the first thing any painter does when having application issues? Nine times out of 10, that painter reaches for thinner, adding it to the coating with the care of a 16-year-old filling his or her gas tank for the first time. Thinner is the first trick every applicator tries when it comes to poor application properties, as most problems arise from very viscous, or thick, industrial coatings. Thinner will reduce the viscosity of the coating, making it significantly easier to spray.

item.title: The Power of Cross-Link Density in Polymer Tank Linings
item.description: Nobody knows precisely how many man-made chemicals exist, but it’s estimated to be around 150,000 total. These chemicals get manufactured, processed, refined, sold and eventually used by the companies and consumers who use them.

item.title: How to Choose the Right Exterior Railcar Coating
item.description: When selecting an exterior railcar coating, the first step should be to identify its performance requirements. Color and gloss retention, chemical resistance and abrasion resistance are just a few factors to consider during this process. Some coatings, like polyurethanes, have higher gloss retention, but their chemical resistance may be lower than other, more suitable technologies. On the other hand, epoxies typically have a higher chemical resistance than polyurethanes, but usually display lower gloss retention. One owner may value appearance, while another may value long-term asset protection—leading them to select different coatings for their railcar fleets.

item.title: Carbozinc 621 PW Zinc-Rich Polyurethane Coating for Water Tanks
item.description: When it comes to zinc, Carboline is an industry-leading innovator. Since the 1960s, the company has been at the helm of this industry by introducing self-curing inorganic zinc-rich primers to market. Before this innovation, zinc-rich primers had to be cured by misting water onto the surface of the coating until it reached a satisfactory hardness. Only three mils of Carboline’s premier Carbozinc coating was used to protect the launch tower at Cape Kennedy Space Center for more than 50 years. Carboline recently won an industry award for the longevity of that project, along with a closet full of other awards for zinc-rich coating projects.

item.title: 4 Best Practices to Avoid Common Concrete Pitfalls
item.description: Coating concrete can be one of the most challenging applications in the industrial coatings market. Contrary to the relatively straightforward process of coating non-porous surfaces like steel, concrete can pose a variety of unique challenges that spontaneously require attention.

item.title: Hot-Dip Galvanizing vs. Inorganic Zinc-Rich Primers
item.description: When applied over carbon steel substrates, the anti-corrosive properties of zinc metal is undeniably one of the most cost-effective solutions for prolonging the service life of steel structures from atmospheric corrosion. Whether the steel is galvanized—typically done through a hot-dip application—or primed with an inorganic zinc-rich primer, the expected service life yielded by cathodically protecting the steel can achieve decades-long performance for most exposures.

item.title: 4 Basic Questions to Consider When Selecting the Right Coating
item.description: Coatings recommendations are one of the most highly debated—and even misunderstood—aspects of the industrial coatings industry. Many different factors go into making the right selection. For instance, have you ever called a coatings manufacturer for a recommendation, only to have your question answered with even more questions?

item.title: FDA-Approved Coatings vs USDA-Approved Coatings
item.description: One of the most common mix-ups in the industrial coating world is the difference between the FDA (Food and Drug Administration), and the USDA (United States Department of Agriculture) approved coatings. item.title: CTSP Episode 061 - ASTM D5402 Solvent Double Rub
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss the details of ASTM D5402, Solvent Rub test for organic coatings. They cover the how and why you need to know this standard.

item.title: CTSP Episode 060 - Isocyanate Technology and moisture
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis are joined by recurring guest, William (Billum) Seawell. The guys discuss the common problems found when urethane technology and isocyanates are exposed to moisture.

item.title: CTSP Episode 059 - Stripe Coating
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss the purpose and process of Stripe Coating. What is it for and should you do it?

item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis wish you a happy holiday season!

item.title: CTSP Episode 054 - Adhesion Value discussion

item.title: CTSP Episode 051 - Color, is it really there?

item.title: CTSP Episode 050 - Amine Blush
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss Amine Blush, where it comes from, how to prevent it, and what to do after you have it.

item.title: CTSP Episode 049 - Accelerators and Additives
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis discuss cold weather coating cure process. They discuss what effects accelerators have on coatings and if they actually lower the acceptable cure temperature minimum.

item.title: CTSP Episode 046 - Hydrostatic Pressure

item.title: CTSP Episode 000 - An Introduction to the Carboline Tech Service Podcast
item.description: Jack Walker and Paul Atzemis introduce listeners to the Carboline Tech Service Podcast. They offer a roadmap for exploration into the show. Subscribe via iTunes, Google Play, or Spotify.
